column4: I have a qustion....how do you have a /home that multiple distros use without having them refuse to let you login due to settings issues?
I am planning a 3 Distro linux box but I want every distro on it to use the same usernames and /home
there is no answer to that in general
you could, for example, use an empty home directory, but I doubt that will be terribly useful
usually, yes, but sometimes another device becomes sda
I have a machine where the memory on one of my mobo devices is sda
on that box, my sata driver is sdb
grub uses a file to determine the correspondance of it's numbers (hd0), etc.  to devices
if that file is wrong, things will not work for you.
look at /boot/grub/device.map, if you have a grub directory at this point
if you have a command line and /sys is mounted, you can find out what sda is pointing to, or conversely what sd your sata drive looks like
I am fairly new to linux so I am not familure with the /sys folder
start by doing   ls /sys/block     that will show you block devices
